meanings.definition: To surpass in passing or going beyond
meanings.sent1: The cheetah outpasses the tortoise in speed.
meanings.sent2: She outpasses her classmates in running.
meanings.sent3: The rabbit outpasses the turtle in a race.
meanings.sent4: Her determination outpasses any obstacle in her way.
meanings.sent5: The eagle outpasses all other birds in flight.

meanings.definition: To exceed in speed or progress
meanings.sent1: The sports car outpasses the old truck in speed.
meanings.sent2: The train outpasses the car on the tracks.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outpasses the snail in a race.
meanings.sent4: His progress outpasses his previous records.
meanings.sent5: The river outpasses its banks during heavy rain.

meanings.definition: To go beyond in excellence or achievement
meanings.sent1: Her artwork outpasses all others in the gallery.
meanings.sent2: The student outpasses the teacher's expectations.
meanings.sent3: The chef outpasses himself with a new dish.
meanings.sent4: His kindness outpasses any other quality he possesses.
meanings.sent5: The team outpasses their rivals in skill and teamwork.
